definition: to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
surname Ce
variant of 策[ce4]

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
variant of 策[ce4]
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: The king's men had been subverted and they killed him in the night.
sentences.chinese: 国王的属下已被策反，在夜里把国王杀了。

sentences.english: Jiang Yuantao and a ministry in drinking to celebrate their instigation successful thing.
sentences.chinese: 江远涛与阿部机关长在喝酒庆祝他们策反成功的事情。

sentences.english: Party Jiangyin fortress incite defection work, but also the non-single day.
sentences.chinese: 我党对江阴要塞的策反工作，也非一日之功。
